badges.name: Reality Distortion Field
badges.description: Your conviction reshapes the environment around you. Strong opinions, emotional commitment, narrative control, and an intensity that makes mediocrity feel shameful.
badges.identityStatement: I am someone whose conviction reshapes the environment around me.

exercises.title: Taste Training
exercises.description: Form 3 sharp opinions about products, designs, or music. Write 2-3 sentences each on what works, what doesn't, and why. No hedging.

exercises.title: Declaration Practice
exercises.description: Make 3+ zero-qualification statements in real interactions today. No 'I think' or 'maybe' ‚Äî flat statements held with conviction.

exercises.title: Flinch Tracking
exercises.description: Track every hedge, qualification, and backpedal you make today. Write down the count and the worst one.

exercises.title: Kill One Identity Leak
exercises.description: Identify and eliminate one identity leak today: hedging language, nervous laughing, over-explaining, fidgeting, phone-checking, apologetic body language.

exercises.title: Narrative Building
exercises.description: Read or refine your narrative ‚Äî the story of what you're building that's slightly ahead of reality. Make it more compelling than yesterday.

badges.name: Frame Control
badges.description: Internal stillness under pressure. Non-reactivity. Holding tension without resolving it. Your frame is yours ‚Äî no one enters without permission.
badges.identityStatement: My frame is mine. No one enters it without my permission. No one moves it without my consent.

exercises.title: Silence Practice
exercises.description: Let 3+ silences exist after you speak today. Don't fill them. Count the seconds.

exercises.title: Tension Tolerance
exercises.description: Enter or sit in 1+ moment of social tension without resolving it. Notice the pull to smooth things over and don't act on it.

exercises.title: Mirror Drill
exercises.description: After 3 interactions today, journal every adjustment you made to match the other person ‚Äî voice, energy, opinion, posture.

exercises.title: Delayed Response
exercises.description: Pause 3+ seconds before responding to 2+ challenging or provocative moments. Break the stimulus-response chain.

exercises.title: Frame Awareness
exercises.description: Journal 3 frames you noticed today ‚Äî in conversations, ads, news, question phrasing. Identify what frame is being set and by whom.

badges.name: Fearlessness
badges.description: Act despite fear. Approach over avoidance. Speed in uncertainty. Recovery from failure. Fear is your compass, not your cage.
badges.identityStatement: I move toward what scares me. Fear is my compass, not my cage.

exercises.title: Daily Fear Dose
exercises.description: Do one thing that scares you today. Non-negotiable. It can be small but it must be real.

exercises.title: Rejection Practice
exercises.description: Deliberately seek 1+ rejection today. Ask for a discount, an upgrade, something unreasonable. Desensitize to 'no'.

exercises.title: First Mover
exercises.description: Be first to speak, decide, or volunteer in 2+ situations today. Don't wait for someone else to go first.

exercises.title: Uncertainty Action
exercises.description: Make 1+ decision today with incomplete information on a 60-second timer. Act, don't revisit.

exercises.title: Exposure Rep
exercises.description: Put yourself in 1 visible, judgeable situation today. Share work, speak up, post publicly ‚Äî somewhere you can be seen and critiqued.

badges.name: Aggression
badges.description: Disgust as fuel. The chip as rocket fuel, not trauma. Refusal to be domesticated. Intensity that comes from deep love for what could be and rage at what is.
badges.identityStatement: I refuse to be domesticated. My intensity comes from love for what could be and rage at what is.

exercises.title: Connect to the Disgust
exercises.description: Write raw, unfiltered truth about something mediocre or unacceptable you encountered today. This is your furnace. Feed it.

exercises.title: Stop Tolerating
exercises.description: Identify one thing you've been tolerating and stop today. Not tomorrow. Today.

exercises.title: Channel the Hit
exercises.description: Next time a negative emotion hits, pour it into productive work within 60 seconds. Convert, don't consume.

exercises.title: Raise the Bar
exercises.description: Take one piece of work or one interaction and raise the standard uncomfortably high. Then hold it.

exercises.title: Physical Intensity
exercises.description: Train in a way that requires accessing actual aggression. Last rep, last round, beyond the comfortable stopping point.

badges.name: Carefreeness
badges.description: Non-attachment to outcomes. Lightness under pressure. Immunity to social opinion. Life is a game you're winning by enjoying.
badges.identityStatement: I play full out and hold on to nothing. Life is a game I'm winning by enjoying.

exercises.title: Release the Grip
exercises.description: Do one thing today and consciously release all attachment to the outcome after acting. Full investment, zero grip.

exercises.title: Say the Unfiltered Thing
exercises.description: Say one thing you'd normally sand down, polish, or soften. Let it land as-is.

exercises.title: Playfulness Injection
exercises.description: Introduce genuine lightness into one serious context today. Not deflecting ‚Äî playing within the pressure.

exercises.title: Let It Fail
exercises.description: Deliberately don't rescue something you'd normally save. Watch what happens without intervening.

exercises.title: Embarrassment Dose
exercises.description: Do something mildly embarrassing on purpose. Own it. Let the cringe pass through you.

badges.name: Presence
badges.description: Total attention on what's in front of you. Sensory aliveness. Stillness of mind. The present moment is the only place where life actually happens.
badges.identityStatement: I am here. Fully. The present moment is the only place where life actually happens, and I don't miss it.

exercises.title: Single Task
exercises.description: Do one thing for 15+ minutes with zero distractions. One tab, one task, one focus. Notice when the pull comes and don't follow it.

exercises.title: Sensory Anchoring
exercises.description: Stop 3+ times today and drop into your senses for 15 seconds. Hear, feel, see, taste the air. Full presence.

exercises.title: Eye Contact
exercises.description: Maintain steady eye contact in 2+ conversations today. Notice when your eyes want to dart away and hold.

exercises.title: Listen Without Preparing
exercises.description: In 2+ conversations, don't formulate your response while they're talking. Let silence exist. Then respond.

exercises.title: Body Scan
exercises.description: Full body awareness scan from head to feet, 2+ times today. 30 seconds each. Notice what you normally miss.

badges.name: Bias to Action
badges.description: Default to movement. Speed as weapon. Ship fast, fail fast, build fast. Momentum is fuel. Start before you're ready.
badges.identityStatement: I move. While others plan, I act. While others deliberate, I ship. Speed is my weapon. Momentum is my fuel.

exercises.title: Two-Minute Rule
exercises.description: Execute 3+ sub-10-minute tasks immediately upon thinking of them. Thought ‚Üí action, zero gap.

exercises.title: Daily Ship
exercises.description: Put one real thing into the world today. A message, deliverable, post, prototype. Something that exists outside your head.

exercises.title: Kill the Planning Loop
exercises.description: For 2+ tasks today, define the single next physical action and do it immediately. No strategy, no framework.

exercises.title: Speed Deadline
exercises.description: Take one timeline and cut it in half. Then try to beat even that.

exercises.title: Prototype First
exercises.description: Build one ugly version of something in under an hour before planning the 'real' thing.
